article.headline: San Francisco 74, Portland 72 (OT)
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Armondo Surratt's driving basket with 7 seconds left in overtime gave San Francisco a 74-72 victory over Portland on Saturday. Surratt, San Francisco's leading scorer, was held scoreless until the overtime period. His first basket, a short baseline jumper, gave the Dons (11-15, 7-5 West Coast Conference) a 70-66 lead with 2:54 left. He finished with four points, 11 below his season average. It was also a tough night for Pooh Jeter and Darren Cooper, Portland's top two scorers for the season. They hit only 7 of 34 shots, including a 1-for-13 effort from the 3-point line. But Jeter and Cooper combined for 10 points during a 12-1 run that gave Portland (10-17, 4-9 WCC) its first lead of the game at 45-43 with 15:30 left in the second half. After that there were eight lead changes but neither team led by more than four points the rest of the way. Portland had a chance to win the game in regulation but Jeter's long 3-point attempt rimmed out with 4 seconds left. That sent the contest to overtime tied at 66.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
